Johnson can’t fire Walton unilaterally. He would need to have Buss on his side for that. Since Walton was hired in 2016, Buss has been an ardent supporter of the former Laker. She is commonly seen as the buffer between Walton and the impetuous Johnson, the last line of defense and reason. – via The Athletic

“At the end of the day, you either get fired or you don’t,” Walton told The Athletic’s Sam Amick. “But when you get fired and you tried to do it to please other people, then you’re going to have regret. If you get fired, but you went out and you did it your way and you coached what you believed in, then you can live with that.” – via The Athletic
